meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sociable.
meanings.sent1: Her sociability shines through at every gathering.
meanings.sent2: His sociability makes him a popular figure in the community.
meanings.sent3: The party was a success thanks to the sociability of the guests.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of technology, maintaining sociability can be a challenge.
meanings.sent5: The dog's sociability with strangers surprised everyone.

meanings.definition: The tendency to seek or enjoy the company of others.
meanings.sent1: His sociability is evident in how he always organizes group activities.
meanings.sent2: Children's natural sociability often leads to forming strong friendships.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sociability with the neighbor's dog was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The sociability of bees in the hive is crucial for their survival.
meanings.sent5: The sociability of the team members contributed to their success.

meanings.definition: The ability to interact easily with others.
meanings.sent1: Her sociability allows her to make friends wherever she goes.
meanings.sent2: The professor's sociability with students creates a positive learning environment.
meanings.sent3: The robot's programmed sociability made it a hit at the tech fair.
meanings.sent4: The sociability of the new employee impressed everyone in the office.
meanings.sent5: The sociability of the elderly residents brightened up the nursing home.
